intro: Chabraea compressa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved chabraea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments within forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
